f7ca272e-6c96-4ee9-96a2-6e5d33012478.text: I regularly revise and communicate a long-term plan for my team.

d8bcb004-ef11-42ce-8d5f-8f51d8a32362.text: Everyone knows what their accountabilities are.

49155d84-7e77-4457-9caa-68f38bba8517.text: Everyone gets their accountabilities done without needing to be reminded.

f2f69dd3-13b9-4ea2-9d7e-147c8f79974d.text: We always take the time to make sure that everyone involved knows exactly what 'done' means.

2f94c579-808a-469a-a889-33d5c2cf92ee.text: Everyone knows where we are going and HOW we are going to get there.

99eaebca-2cc8-4915-85d4-3f1c2b02afe5.text: EVERYONE has specific weekly numbers that they need to hit

4043abdd-0610-4fde-9ee6-3fd65536266f.text: Activity assignments are published for everyone to see each week

652dc11b-c235-4158-993e-7474e48b89f0.text: Everyone knows when someone misses their weekly assigned activities

d2acdade-4bdc-4207-beba-cae592c06316.text: We have weekly meetings, but no one is held accountable.

fb6480e9-f721-4109-82b5-d144b3ca75e8.text: There is often conflict and drama between team members.

2c958994-9800-4856-954f-b59e1f8c26ce.text: When a person misses deadlines or doesn't get things done, no one confronts them.

0be22c6d-15da-4b76-a952-2ddd06a4c6b1.text: We use long-term objectives to guide weekly task assignments

e17af4ba-2c80-4491-9062-2c5140b03753.text: EACH team member has autonomy to make key decisions in performing their role.

38a2c293-ffd0-4b93-8f4b-8c539eefd071.text: Everyone knows exactly what their boss expects them to do; how to be a 'Rockstar' in their job.

47a60ccd-815a-442d-ba3c-69186afb1902.text: Team members have defined areas where they have decision making authority.

b35aa690-1695-469c-a6b2-b46ce2cd80ea.text: Our organization has shared overarching rules that outline expectations of staff behavior

459d0dff-6886-4046-94d6-342b2fc5bd92.text: Staff feels that leadership team members aren't in agreement on priorities.

bdda783c-acb6-4fff-8b2f-4b477f0d4b9a.text: People are aware of when they in-line with expected behavior or not.

8bd55f54-5115-4638-8627-a7d7ae0b463e.text: Our leadership team takes time every few months to spend dedicated time thinking and planning.

e0963db4-bebf-4640-868b-87792985a16b.text: All of our organizational long-term goals are clear, specific and measurable

d790d95d-d48c-4488-a1cb-3d1f462f077c.text: Leadership team members undermine one another in front of staff.

075e1d54-f9c2-410d-a87e-77616da48d2a.text: Everyone in the organization can articulate the long-term goals and top priorities.

7a819ca1-768b-4c53-9621-efbd44c18eff.text: People disagree about which things to get done first.

fa801864-0cb6-46e5-9c31-45dd06bb2a4c.text: We have a shared Accountability Chart.

1bdb7127-cb9b-473e-875f-42a683d3974a.text: As a business leader, I reinforce the plan and priorities with my team at least once a week, informally or formally.

e5636566-ef8b-4934-8ae2-2e2a815539ec.text: It is difficult to tell if staff are actually doing the right things from week to week to help us to achieve our organizational goals.

accountability.lowComment: If your team places greater priority on accountability, it will make a big difference.  Use <these these techniques> to get started right away

people.lowComment: Try <this technique> to improve communication between team members

strategy.highComment: Your team has an understanding of the strategy and vision.  Use <this technique> to continue improving
strategy.lowComment: Communicate strategy and long-term vision to your team.  Use <these techniques> to get started today

accountability.highComment: Great job with the accountability.  Use <this technique> to keep it up
accountability.lowComment: Improving accountability will make a big difference.  Use <these these techniques> to get started right away

people.lowComment: Try <this technique> to improve human resources management
